segments.text: I see a woman standing at the kitchen sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She is diligently drying a plate with a towel, completely absorbed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her focus seems entirely fixed on that one simple task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, the faucet is running, and the sink is completely full.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water is now pouring over the front edge of the basin in a steady stream.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It streams down the cabinet doors, forming a growing puddle on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: A significant amount of water has already collected at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice her foot is already submerged in the cold water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not feel it, or even hear the splashing sound?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her expression remains perfectly neutral, she appears utterly unaware of the overflow.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's truly baffling to witness such a complete lack of perception.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Soon the entire kitchen floor will be a shallow pool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she'll ever look down from her dish-drying trance.
segments.speaker: PAR
